description.narrative: Our intermediary target group are the ‘direct key actors’ within our programme; being: the staff and leaders of our 9 local partners, as well as all FF and SSE members that are provided training, business strengthening, financial services, market facilitation etc. The target group we aim to reach throughout the programme are 14,330 farmers and entrepreneurs, of which: 4,299 FF (2,294 women, 319 youth) and 10,031 SSE (7,021 women, 1,400 youth). Our final beneficiaries are the members of the MBOs within our programme: organized family farmers (FF) and small-scale entrepreneurs (SSE). Outreach in baseline: 71,121 – out of which 31,800 FF (17,000 women, 3,550 youth), and 39,321 SSE (27,300 women, 4,200 youth).

Strengthened social enterprises led by family farmer and small scale entrepreneurs building local economies and promoting inclusive growth and gender equality, while addressing the impact of climate change, in Bicol region and Metro Manila and surrounding provinces, Philippines

The Philippine programme seeks to substantially increase the income and wellbeing of family farmers (FF) and small-scale entrepreneurs (SSE), and within these the subsistence Family Farmers and small-Scale Entrepreneurs, women and youth, and other excluded groups. They are empowered to achieve their social, economic and political inclusion in the whole realm of the development process. Vehicle for the promotion and the sustainability of their development are their cooperatives and associations or Member-Based Organizations (MBOs) with a mission and culture of inclusive economic development. Nine (9) MBOs in Bicol region and in metropolitan Manila are provided with holistic capacity building to become more relevant, effective, representative, inclusive and sustainable. They are supported to work structurally and transform the organization towards equality in favor of the above target groups in the organization, enterprise, and ultimately in the household, the state and society; particularly in their access to economic resources and assets, and inclusion in economic value chains, responsibilities and decision taking, and social and climate risk protection services. The MBOs’ social enterprises are strengthened to bring in economic and social equalizing measures that improve FF and SSE production and marketing efficiency, and market access, in general, and especially in the value chains of organic rice, abaca (manila hemp), dairy, pilinut, pineapple, coconut, citronella, fishery, home/community based industries and mass consumer goods. They provide secure and equal access to tailor-fit integrated business services; productive resources and inputs; technical knowledge; finance; market positioning and value addition, including services enhancing climate risk resilience and environmental sustainability. Lobby and advocacy are strengthened for the MBOs to become a voice reckoned with in inclusive economic and social development. Strategic partnerships are sought with multiple private and public stakeholders for sharing of knowledge, expertise, technology, resources, and business links.

description.narrative: Strengthened social enterprises led by family farmers and small scale entrepreneurs building local economies and promoting inclusive growth and gender equality, while addressing the impact of climate change, in Bicol region and Metro Manila and surrounding provinces, Philippines

title.narrative: 1.4: x% of the member-based organisations’ objectives targeting an increase in their membership base (outreach general) have been realised satisfactorily

description.narrative: chosen indicator: # members (total)

title.narrative: 2.2: x% of the member-based organisations’ objectives targeting adoption of (environmentally) sustainable production techniques by their members have been realised satisfactorily

description.narrative: chosen indicator: # members having adopted sustainable agricultural practices

title.narrative: 1.1: x% of the member-based organisations’ objectives targeting financial autonomy/diversification of its income sources have been realised satisfactorily

description.narrative: chosen indicator: # MBO's with a donor income of below 45%

title.narrative: 1.2: x% of the member based organizations’ objectives targeting increased satisfaction of members with services & information received from their organisation have been realised satisfactorily

description.narrative: chosen indicator: # MBO's with an average member satisfaction score of 3 or 4

title.narrative: 2.1: x% of the member-based organisations’ objectives targeting application of newly acquired knowledge, skills & improved techniques by their members have been realised satisfactorily

description.narrative: chosen indicator: # members having applied their business development training

comment.narrative: The progress score of the MBOs was too low to reach the satisfactory level of 75%.

title.narrative: 1.6: x% of the member-based organisations’ objectives targeting better access to markets, finance etc. for their members have been realised satisfactorily

description.narrative: chosen indicator: # members linked to the market (intermediaries, customers)

title.narrative: 1.5: x% of the member-based organisations’ objectives targeting improvement of their members’ skills (farmers & entrepreneurs) have been realised satisfactorily

description.narrative: chosen indicator: # members trained in entrepreneurship (business plan dvpt + marketing/sales - in both agri & SSE-context)

title.narrative: 2.3: x% of the member-based organisations’ objectives targeting improvement of the economic activities in terms of cost-efficiency, sales etc. of their members have been realised satisfactorily

description.narrative: chosen indicator: # members with increased profit from sales (increase of >=15%)

title.narrative: 1.0: x% of the member-based organisations’ objectives targeting improvement of the skills and attitudes of their leaders have been realised satisfactorily

description.narrative: chosen indicator: # of (existing and potential) leaders with true leadership competences

comment.narrative: Only one out of the 4 MBOs who selected this indicator made sufficient progress (at leats 75%). Although the other MBOs made progress, it was not sufficient due to the pandemic.

title.narrative: 3.1: x% of the member based organizations’ objectives targeting improvement of their members’ (socio-political & physical) business environment have been realised satisfactorily

description.narrative: chosen indicator: # of L&A successes (~# improved legal texts/policies as a result of lobby activities; # (categories of) public investments being increased;…)

title.narrative: 3.2: x% of the member based organizations’ objectives through which the MBOs and their members contribute to a more inclusive and socially improved environment have been realised satisfactorily

description.narrative: chosen indicator: # of employed with decent work provided by FF (Coop) and SSEs

title.narrative: 1.3: x% of the member-based organisations’ objectives targeting more involvement & participation of their members in decision-making have realised satisfactorily

description.narrative: chosen indicator: % of invited members participating in General Assembly Meetings

title.narrative: 3.3: x% of the member based organizations’ objectives through which the MBOs and their members actively contribute to the preservation and improvement of the natural environment have been realised satisfactorily

description.narrative: chosen indicator: number of natural resource( area)s protected from further degeneration (nr of water sources, forest areas, land)// hectares of watershed
